duties_responsibilities.duty: Supervise and manage the monitoring process according to internal procedures and schedules, ensuring adherence to compliance standards.
Stay up-to-date with regulatory changes and industry standards to update and maintain compliance department policies and procedures.
Provide direction and guidance on policy and procedure to business units, and assist in the maintenance and updating of the Company’s Compliance Resource Library.
Identify, communicate, and assess regulatory changes to effectively communicate to impacted business units/employees throughout the organization.
Develop and apply new preventative techniques and methods that identify compliance and legal exposures to the Company based on regulatory changes.

Act as a subject matter expert in the development of annual Compliance training content based on regulatory requirements and risk-based prioritization; coordinates training deployment with the Company’s Training Department.
Prepare meaningful and timely reports as required under management practices, and works collaboratively with other employees to support the overall objectives of the department.
Treat people with respect; keeps commitments; inspires the trust of others; works ethically and with integrity; upholds organizational values; accepts responsibility for own actions.
Follows policies and procedures; completes tasks correctly and on time; supports the company’s goals and values.
Follows monitoring, testing, and reporting processes to generate quantitative and qualitative reporting, and manages reporting to proactively control compliance risks.
Works collaboratively with other employees to support the overall objectives of the department, and interacts appropriately and professionally with Regulators and auditors.
Participates in community development activities outside the organization in support of the Company’s Community Reinvestment goals.
Performs duties specific to the position and other functions as assigned.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree or more than 5 years of related experience and/or training within the financial industry.
